Sequence Information.Source: Amino acid substitution, insect pro-rich peptide analog, ainmal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (94.44%) toOvispirinI: 28%; R: 17%; K: 22%.Activity: active against 9 strains P. aeruginosa (MIC 0.11-12.7 ug/ml), 5 strains S. maltophilia (MIC 0.29-3.6 ug/ml), L. monocytogenes EGD (MIC 1.4 ug/ml), and S. aureus 930918 (MIC 4.6 ug/ml).Toxicity: human RBC: 2.5% hemolysis at 80 ug/ml (little hemo.lytic HC50 > 80 ug/ml).Structure:  CD: helical in 33% TFE, 1 mg/ml LPS, and 1mg/ml LTA. NMR: helix-break-helix motif in TFE.You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.
Literature Information.Author: Sawai MV, Waring AJ, Kearney WR, McCray PB Jr, Forsyth WR, Lehrer RI, Tack BF. 2002
Literature Information.Title: Impact of single-residue mutations on the structure and function of ovispirin/novispirin antimicrobial peptides
